availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Simpson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Lawler. Father of Samuel F. Lawler, N. Lawler, A. E. Lawler, M. E. Lawler, William H. Lawler, Finley Lawler, Mary Lawler, and Henry C. Lawler. Resident in Simpson County, Kentucky, in 1840. Owned seven enslaved persons in Simpson County in 1840. Farmer in Simpson County in 1850. Owned twenty-nine enslaved persons in Simpson County in 1850. Farmer in Simpson County in 1860. Owned nineteen enslaved persons in Simpson County in 1860. Household owned three additional enslaved persons in Simpson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Mortality Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, Franklin Ward 4, p. 1406.
